SENT.plain: Fifty cases of verified intracranial ruptured saccular aneurysm were analyzed to investigate the relationship of the development of a delayed cerebral ischemic deficit to the presence of cerebral vasospasm visualized on angiography
Twenty-five patients developed a delayed ischemic deficit (DID), and all showed Grade 3+ or 4+ vasospasm
Nineteen patients had Grade 0, 1+, or 2+ vasospasm, and none developed a DID
It was concluded that in this study vasospasm accounted for all DID's and that in the absence of vasospasm DID did not occur
The DID occurred most often on Day 8 (7 of 25 cases)
